Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2007 10:09PM Linkimgin wrote: My lump felt like something totally different that any other tissue in my breasts. I found my lump. Stage II ductal carcinoma, 2.3 cm, high grade tumor. My lump felt hard, slightly movable, oblong. I knew right away that it was breast cancer.
Posts.Title: WHAT did YOUR lump FEEL like? gscott MomOfTeenGirl01

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2007 02:05PM Linkimgin wrote: I'm not freaked out either. I was diagnosed last month. I was frantic  waiting for the initial results of the test. But when the doctor called me, I took it fine and since then, I have not even cried. Am I in denial? no way. I just kind of feel...like I have a lot of work ahead of me for the the next six months to a year. People around me are more upset than I am and my best friend sent me this horrible book titled "Why Me?" I looked at the title and said out loud, "well why not me" lots of women get cancer and I am brac 1 positive and five of my immediate family members had cancer. Don't worry about your response, it is, what it is. and that's ok.
Posts.Title: Why am I not upset? Barbara1 Mary-Lou

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2007 03:13AM Linkimgin wrote: Dear Amy, Of course you have been knocked for a loop with this news. We are here for you. I have some good news for you. My sister had a very similar diagnosis and she did extremely well with radiation and chemo.  She was cancer free for seven years, had a minor set back and cancer free for three. You hang in there.
Posts.Title: Pathology report---NOT Good Amy1971 nancy01
